Posts.Content: Dragonfly1000 wrote: Hello,  I am a new triple negative breast cancer patient.  Found tumor 6-17, mastectomy of 1 breast, and tram flap reconstruction 7-18, C-Diff and back in hospital 7-25.  First AC treatment 8-18 followed by Neulasta.  Initially, was able to manage the symptoms, reflux on everything - even water, constipation, diarrhea, and couldn't get food down.  Worst symptoms have been migranes, hemorrhoids, and today it is starting to look like colitis.  Does anyone have any suggestions how to get rid of the colitis and prevent it going forward.  There are so many brave people on this site sharing tips.  I read several blogs for chemo symptoms but did not see any suggestions for colitis.  My other challenge is getting sufficient liquid, as I was never a person to drink alot.  Appreciate any help.  Thank you Andrea Dragonfly Dx 6/28/2011, IDC, 2cm, Stage IIA, Grade 3, 0/2 nodes, ER-/PR- Log in to post a reply
